data.title: Sunday brunch not up to par
data.text: I wanted to like the place, but it didn't cooperate.  Although our waiter tried to give decent service and make the experience pleasant, she got no help with this endeavor from the rest of the elements: food, setting, and other staff.  Brunch was supposed to start at 11 am.  We arrived early.  A staff person advised that things were running late. We finally got seated about 11:30. Wait staff seemed to be milling about, ineffectual, several moving lethargically. No hustle. No one came around with coffee refills. The food was a big disappointment: way too salty, too downscale, no fresh fruit, green salad leaves starting to go downhill (dark and slimy), sloppy potato salad heavy on the mayo (and I love mayo), no labels. Uninspired food with no special touches. Uninspiring presentation: no fresh flowers, no white table cloths. We were seated in a small eating area off the bar, while the dining room was closed and dark. This is Sunday brunch, folks! It should be lovely and special, the centerpiece of the hotel's restaurant, the high point of the week. The staff should be excited to contribute to the guests' enjoyment. Instead, this was just sad all around. Reluctantly, can't recommend. I expected better from a Hilton, old hotel or not. Employees need leadership, and Hilton needs to get this place back on track.

data.title: Dinner on the Veranda
data.text: This was our first time to dine at the Partridge Inn & Grill in the Partridge Inn Hotel. We sat out on the veranda in the evening and it was very pleasant. This hotel has been redone beautifully.  Nice modern, contemporary atmosphere in an Augusta landmark! The menu was not extensive but we found some things we liked based on local cuisine. Good wait service and very attentive.

data.text: The first nigth we ordered dessert and it was pretty much store bought stuff and both the chocolate cake and cheese cake were covered in raspberry sauce which was weird.  We went for dinner the second night and breakfast the last day.  The food was good but service just seemed so unorganized.  I didnt feel like anyone was managing the resturant at all.

data.title: Taking my money elsewhwre
data.text: New to Augusta and was excited to visit PI and experience an awesome meal. For a Friday night there was literally no one dining. That should have been clue #1. The server was friendly but disappeared quite a bit. The draft beer was not working and there was no menu for bottled beer. I ended up getting the $32 ny strip. The steak was flavorful and cooked correctly. The sides were awful. The spinach bake was charred and the potato was burned. The plating was terrible. I just wanted to be impressed with a fabulous meal at a fabulous hotel and it just missed the mark.

data.title: Soooo yummy!!
data.text: Oh, we LOVED our dinner at the PI Bar and Grill! The selection was fantastic, and our food was even better. Cooked to perfection and tasted amazing. Not to mention the service was impeccable. Couldn't believe how wonderful our experience was here. They've recently hired a new chef... He definitely knows exactly what he's doing with their food! data.title: We were so excited about our weekend!
data.text: Let me start by saying how excited my husband and I were for our weekend getaway here - the place looked so sweet. Then we arrived. The experience was one I would equate with a mediocre motel 8 and not historic or pricy get away. For starters, there were issues with our room and the fix took a chunk out of our first day. Staff members were seemingly lax about our issues and did nothing to make us feel accommodated or welcome until we requested something for our time and hassle. Which then took us to the bartender who was simply the WORST!! First, he handed me a food menu when I specifically asked for a drink menu, then joked it off like I was a moron saying oh yeah I don't have one of those. He continued to say he could make anything but then laughed when my husband requested a Mohito and snarked when I requested a gimlet - claiming I'd hate it. Pardon me for knowing what I like, thank you very much. It never got any better. I can't believe we actually had to pay him for these drinks.

data.title: Trying to be Really Nice but, No, It's Not Worth the Money
data.text: I'm giving this place 3 Pegs because, well, the servers / help / everyone was so darn nice that it anything less would feel like =I= was being just mean. Really, it deserves 2 Pegs but let me explain why I'm giving it 3 Pegs instead. First, the server and hostess were beyond engaging, fun, friendly, and knew the menu. They worked hard at being down to earth and genuinely seemed to care about my experience. Unfortunately, they need some help in the training of fine dining service, and the kitchen needs more than a little work. Let's start with the drinks. I was greeted and seated immediately but at a table that was a bit too close to a middle age couple just seated 15 seconds ahead of me and obviously celebrating an anniversary (I even heard his toast to their 17 years together -- nice job with the toast and God bless them on their anniversary).  Instead of accepting the seat very near (one foot) an intimate occasion, I asked for the next table over. No problem. I was given that table and that gave the Anniversary Couple a bit of space for their celebration without me seeming to listen to their life tales. A+ to the hostess for allowing me to give that couple their space. Back to the drinks ... I was in the mood for beer but, alas, the draft mechanism was out of order. Strike One. I ask what was in bottle or can but they didn't have a beer listing. Strike Two since the bar is attached the restaurant and you would think they would have a draft menu in print. The server departs for bread and Lady #2 appears and she explains they have Anchor Steam (excellent beer) and Harpoon UFO White, which just so happens to be my Go To Beer. So that is Plus 1 because Harpoon UFO is like God touching water. But then  Lady #2 says that she is a sommelier and they have some very nice wines and hands me the wine list. Eh, decent list. There was a Russian River pinot noir I had never heard of before and she began to describe it to me, saying it would match nicely with the Tomahawk Pork Chop I was considering (I assume server girl told her that is what I was asking about). So I get a prosecco starter and the Russian River pinot for the main course. Now let me say that everything the sommelier said about the wine was spot on, and I do mean spot on. It was a decent wine, one that would run $15 in a grocery store but means $45 for the restaurant price, or $9 a glass. Half way through the meal she came back and told me the winery is one of Zac Brown's associated enterprises --- didn't mean anymore or any less to me, but it was an interesting tidbit to know. The appetizer was the Peaches and Burrata Cheese, but I didn't particularly like it. Peaches were bland and the bread crumbs in the course were either very soggy or very stale -- nothing in between. The Tomahawk pork chop was a fine cut of meat that looked like, well, a tomahawk. Problem was I ordered medium and it came out well done. It was a top what I would describe as homemade fried potatoes like my Mom would cook growing up --- thin sliced potatoes placed in a frying pan with some oil, fried with =maybe= a bit of crisp. Not these potatoes. They were not done and still had the raw potato taste. A few slices were cooked properly but most were just barely a shade past raw. The asparagus was not completely cooked either, and still had that raw, rubbery texture. All that was Strike Three, with several foul balls before hand. But the pork chop was a good cut, though it was not marinated nor seasoned very well. When the server asked how I enjoying the meal, I told her about the potatoes and asparagus, and she graciously offered to bring me something else, thought I declined since the pork chop was large enough and decent enough to make a meal.  Now before you think I'm being nit picky, I'm not. But I'm still giving 3 Pegs because the place is beautiful and the people are so genuinely Southern Nice that I just can't give it the 2 Pegs it really deserved. But I'm not paying that much again for a meal that was not prepared properly. Servers were nice but not seriously trained in upscale service. Kitchen needs a lot of work. The piano / trumpeter were good -- relaxing.  Wait Staff = B minus. Sommelier =  B minus. Kitchen = C minus minus. Quality of meat = B minus. Atmosphere = B+. Wine selection = C. Beer selection = B minus. Not really a place for kids as this is a special occasion / date night / or adult gathering place. I'm hoping this was a bad night for the kitchen and not indicative of the place in total because this could be a great place to have an upscale dinner with top tier service and $$$ prices that I would be willing to pay ... if only.

data.title: Seriously
data.text:
Saying we eat out often is an under statement. It was bound to happen sooner or later, just never expected it to be here, at a Hilton property. Being diamond with Hilton, I've seen a few hiltons. 

The restaurant appears quite nice, modern, well laid out, etc. the service was ok. There was one other table in play when I arrived, but still service was only ok. Once orders were placed, and food began to appear, there were mistakes on the order, but a salads a salad! Kitchen did not have a fresh catch, or was able to split orders! What's on the menu is what's on the plate. 

The waiter did try, but had not a lot to work with. There are way too many better options in this market at this price point to consider eating here again. 

Should have settled on the burger after all.

data.title: Very disappointing!
data.text: Our family was very excited to try out the new and improved Partridge Inn brunch for Mother's Day.  Even though they were busy, we only had a short wait with reservations.  Our first impressions included dirty glasses on our table with lipstick stains, dirty plates at the buffet, empty trays of food, broken glass on the floor, poor presentations of food, and very disorganized and unprofessional staff.  The shrimp and grits and roast beef were good...the staff was very curt with answers, and we had several encounters that showed they did not want to be there.  There were no plates for dessert which looked like pre-packaged choices. For $45/per person, we were expecting excellence.  This experience did not deliver, and we were underwhelmed with food while overwhelmed by the exorbitant price for the service we received.  We will not be returning...
